episode_summary: This episode covers a variety of intriguing topics, including Thomas Edison's near-death experience with a badger, unique seaweed-eating animals, the irony of an electric cargo ship transporting coal, and the history of food quality control with a focus on jelly consistency testing.

facts.fact: Thomas Edison was once almost killed by a flying badger.
There are only two groups of animals on Earth that live entirely on seaweed, and they are a type of iguana and a type of sheep.
In 2017, China launched the world's first electric cargo ship, which is now being used exclusively to carry coal to power stations.
The first ever instrument made for food quality control was built to test the consistency of jelly.
